turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Sir -- we charged!..Gentlemen -- and I hope you will quote me -- I cannot say too much for the courage of the men who followed me into that Cheyenne camp...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: <U>Cheyenne</U>! What Cheyenne?

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That camp you hit was Nawyecka Comanche...Chief Scar's bunch...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: My name's Edwards...I'm looking for my niece...she was in that camp when you attacked...

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Well...I know there were some captives recovered...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Are you sure they didn't die of carbine shots fired by a bunch o' Yank bluebellies so scared they couldn't tell the difference between a Cheyenne and a Comanche?

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Keefer!..Put this man under arrest!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That'll be the day...  'As we developed the village'... Next time you develop a village, hit it where the fightin' men are... You won't get any headlines for killin' squaws.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Not quite...Quarter Cherokee. The rest is Welsh...So they tell me.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You've done a lot of growin'...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Somethin' mighty fishy about this trail, Uncle Ethan...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Stop callin' me 'uncle'...I ain't your uncle.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Don't have to call me 'sir' neither... Nor grampaw neither...Nor Methuselah neither...I can whup you to a frazzle.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What you want me to call you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Name's Ethan...Now what's so mighty fishy about this trail?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well, fust off...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well, come on!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Easy!  It's forty miles, sonny...Horses can do with some grain and a little rest.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nothing for you to see.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Leggo...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: All right...but I'm givin' the orders...You take 'em or we split up here and now...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Why, sure, Ethan...There's just the one thing we're after...finding Deborah and Lucy...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If they're still alive...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Easy on that!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Sorry...We don't even know if Debbie 'n Lucy are with this bunch...Maybe they split up...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They're with 'em -- if they're still alive.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You want us to fire a shot if...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No...nor build bonfires...nor beat drums neither. I'll meet you on the far side.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You all right, Ethan?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Huh...?  Sure I'm all right...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Say!...What happened to your blanket? Lose it?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Must've...Anyway, I ain't goin' back to look for it...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What you goin' to do?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Get some sleep...Tomorrow's another day...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Say it. We're beat!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No...our turnin' back don't change anything...not in the long run. If she's alive, she's safe...for a while...They'll keep her to raise as one of their own, 'til she's of an age to...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: And you think we got a chance to find her?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: An Injun will chase a thing til he thinks he's chased it enough...Then he quits...Same when he runs...Seems he never learns there's such a thing as a critter that might just keep comin' on...So we'll find them in the end, I promise you that...We'll find them just as sure as the turning of the earth.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Good night...Laurie...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Good night...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Jorgensen's been runnin' his cattle with my own...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: YOUR cattle?...<U>DEBBIE'S</U> cattle!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He's agreed to take you on and share the increase from my herd while I'm gone...I'll be pushin' on tomorrow...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I ain't stayin'...I set out lookin' for Debbie...I aim to keep on...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Because she's my...my...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She's your nothin'...She's no kin to you at all!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I always felt like she was...Her folks takin' me in, raisin' me like one of their own...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That don't make 'em kin...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: All right...I ain't got no kin... I'm goin' to keep lookin' that's all.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How? You got any horses, or money to buy 'em...You ain't even got money to buy cartridges...Jorgensen's offering you a good livin' here...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Martin...I want you to know some- thin'...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yeah...you want me to know I ain't got no kin -- no money -- no horses -- nothing but a dead man's clothes to wear!..You tole me that already... Now shut your head!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Hey! What's the idea...?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Maybe I'm gettin' like Mose Harper -- my bones is cold tonight...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not so funny...if you recollect what 'Nawyecka' means...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sorta like 'roundabout' -- like a man says he's goin' one place when he means to go just the reverse...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You all settled an' comfortable now?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Futterman?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He just couldn't wait...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Whatchu doin'?...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Let's go...I think I stumbled onto somethin'...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Scar?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: When are you goin' to learn to keep your mouth shut! Come on. Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: But I just bought a good blanket.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Forget it...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What I heard back there was that a band o' hostile Nawyeckas came through this way less'n two weeks ago...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Think it might be...?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: <U>YOU</U> don't understand, ya chunkhead! <U>You</U> didn't buy any blanket! Ya bought <U>her</U>!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You got yourself a <U>wife</U>, sonny!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh no! Tell her she's got to go back...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: And have her whole family after our scalps for floutin' one o' their women?...No sir! Come on, Mrs. Pauley...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That's the way to train 'em. Looks like Mrs. Pauley's goin' to make you a fine beautiful wife...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Cut it out, will ya...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Says her name's Wild Goose Flying in the Night Sky...but she'll answer to Look since it pleases ya...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Look?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You ask her!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Look!  Scar?...  Do you know where he went? And if he has a girl with him...a <U>white</U> girl -- nai-bist pabo taibo...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Beats me how she could get that pony out o' camp without neither of us hearin' a thing...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She ain't goin' back to her family, that's certain...not if she took off where the arrow points.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Think she means for us to follow?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How should <U>I</U> know...She's YOUR wife!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I think maybe we oughta...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yeah, I kinda figgered you'd say that...Bein' a new husband and all...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Ethan, quit it!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nine...  Ten!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What's the sense in it!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Least, <U>THEY</U> won't feed any Comanches this winter...Killin' buffalo's as good as killin' Injuns in this country.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Peaceful tribes depend on the buffalo, too....

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Ain't that too bad...If you feel that sorry for your kinfolk, I'm surprised you didn't take up with that squaw wife of yours...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, you're a widower now...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What'd the soldiers have to kill her for!..

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No...She's not...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I ain't sure...Where's that doll?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Lemme alone...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You breeds are all alike -- two drinks an'...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Suit yourself...While you're enjoyin' your little conversation, I'll be ridin' out with Senor Fernandez here... The Comanch' medicine country ain't far...there's one camp with a chief named Cicatriz.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Never heard of him...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Cicatriz is Mex for <U>Scar</U>...an' he has a white girl in his tepee...Be seein' you...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Stay out here.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Not likely.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You figger Scar means to kill us?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He's got to...All these years, run- nin', dodgin', knowin' we were after him...Now we caught up...It's him or us.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Why didn't he make his move back there?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't know...Somethin' tied his hands...maybe hospitality...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How? She's even forgot her own language!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Debbie, you're comin' with us! Hear me?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Go on! Get out of here while you can...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Over there!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They'll be back...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We won't be here...Come on!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: 'I, Ethan Edwards, being of sound mind and without any blood kin, do hereby bequeath all my property of any kind to Martin Pauley...'  I don't want your property.... 'Sides, what do you mean no 'blood kin?' Debbie's your blood kin...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not no more.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You can keep your will!  I ain't forgettin' you was all set to shoot her yourself...What kind o' man are you, anyway.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She's been with the bucks! She's nothin' now but a...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What's that got to do with us?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Wait! We go chargin' in, they'll kill her...and you know it.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It's what I'm countin' on.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I know you are...Only it ain't goin' to be that way...she's alive...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Livin' with Comanches ain't bein' alive...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: She's alive...Better she's alive and livin' with Comanches than her brains bashed out...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I saw it...And don't try to tell me it was Aunt Martha's or Lucy's...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You don't remember it, but I remember. That was your mother's scalp!

turns.speaker: KEEFER
turns.text: Was your niece about their age?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not far from it...

turns.speaker: KEEFER
turns.text: Hard to realize they're white, isn't it...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They're not white any more -- they're <U>Comanche</U>!...Let's see the bodies...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, we only got the one lead -- Scar...And where we begin to look, I don't know...

turns.speaker: KEEFER
turns.text: There's one thing. We recovered a bushel of trinkets in that camp... cheap stuff...trade goods...Couldn't help noticing that most of it was Mexican...Maybe if you could talk to some of those Mexican traders along the border...What do they call themselves?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Comancheros...

turns.speaker: KEEFER
turns.text: That's the breed...Course it might take time.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Time's running out...But I'm obliged to you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'd be obliged if you'd get to the point, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MRS. JORGENSEN
turns.text: I am...I am...It's just that I know Martha'd want you to think of her boys as well as her girls...And if the girls are...dead...Ethan, don't let the boys waste their lives in vengeance!

turns.speaker: MRS. JORGENSEN
turns.text: Well, you did all a body could, Ethan.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I got your boy killed.

turns.speaker: MRS. JORGENSEN
turns.text: Don't go blamin' yourself...

turns.speaker: MRS. JORGENSEN
turns.text: Why it's just a snip of calico...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You ever see it before...like mebbe on a dress Debbie wore?

turns.speaker: MRS. JORGENSEN
turns.text: Yes!..Yes, I remember!..Have they found her, Ethan?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No...not yet...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She's not a little girl any more.

turns.speaker: MRS. JORGENSEN
turns.text: You've seen her!...She's alive?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I've seen her...and she's alive.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Oh, all right! Well...Martin says...

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: From the beginning...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: 'Dear Miss Laury'...He spells it with a Y instead of an I...E...Wouldn't you think he'd know...

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: Who cares what he spells it? Read the letter.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Dear Miss Laury...I take pen in hand to let you know Ethan and me still are trying to catch up with them Com- anches the late Mister Futterman told us about...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: The <U>late</U> Mister Futterman?

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: That means Mister Futterman is dead, by golly.

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: Every young man should at least once...Go on, Laurie! Read!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: A little Comanche squaw - SQUAW!

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: They never find that girl.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Yours truly...  And he even has to write his full name...Martin Pauley...not even just <U>Martie</U>!...  I don't care if he <U>never</U> comes back!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Don't go takin' that stuff...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Ain't worth the mendin'...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: What you gettin' red-in-the-face for?...I have brothers, haven't I?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well I ain't one of 'em!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I'm a woman, Martie...  We wash and mend your dirty clothes all our lives...When you're little we even wash <U>you</U>....How a man can ever make out to get bashful in front of a woman I'll never know...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You talk like a feller might just as leave run around nekkid...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Wouldn't bother me...  I wouldn't try it in front of pa, though, was I you...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Might at least have left me my pants!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Shush!...Time for bed anyway...  Likely these'll need some takin' in...Oh, Martie, you're that gaunted! ...Ma's havin' a turkey for dinner tomorrow and...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Futterman!...He's got a little tradin' post on the South Fork o' the Brazos...Laurie, I just got to get me a good horse! Think yer pa would...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Finish your breakfast...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I gotta catch up with him, Laurie!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Go on then! Pa's in the barn saddlin' the Fort Worth stud... an' you can take the light gelding with the blaze...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: But that's Sweet-face -- your own good horse.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Take it and welcome...but don't count on finding me here when you get back...I've been dallying around this god-forsaken wind-scour almost two long years waitin' for you...I ain't cut out to be an old maid!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I can't help it, Laurie...I just gotta catch up with Ethan...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I...I wrote you a letter...Reckon you didn't get it...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: One letter in five years...I read it till the paper dried up and the writing faded out...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: It wasn't much of a letter...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: No, it wasn't...You mighta said you loved me...You mighta asked me to wait...At least that'd have been something...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: But I allus loved you...You know that, without my sayin' it...I couldn't bring myself to ask you to wait...the little I had... not knowin' how much longer until we found Debbie...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: It isn't fair...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Don't cry, Laurie...I understand how it is...I'll just go 'way...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You do and I'll die, Martie...I will! I'll just die!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Martie...don't go! Not this time.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You crazy?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: It's too late...She's a woman grown now...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I got to fetch her home...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Fetch <U>what</U> home?...The leavin's of Comanche bucks -- sold time an' again to the highest bidder?...With savage brats of her own, most like?...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: <U>Laurie</U>! Shut your mouth!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Do you know what Ethan will do if he has a chance?...He'll put a bullet in her brain! And I tell you Martha would want him to!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Only if I'm dead!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: She'd be about thirteen now...

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: We got two around that age...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: You'll have to wait until we reach the agency...Fall in behind the column...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: But couldn't you...?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Sorry...  Keep the column moving!..Close ranks there!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Why else?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Come on, say it.  You know...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Say it anyway.  Come on, how much do you love me?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: "With you, my life began and with you shall it end..."

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I have to cut his windpipe...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You're not a doctor, you'll hurt him!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What else should I do, damn it, he's dying!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Ellen, move aside...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh God, Tommi...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Stop that!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You'll never get away from me!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: So, how does it feel to be kissed by two women?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: They say it's fantastic.  At least that's what I read in a men's magazine.  So who are the two lucky ones?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Me and the muse, of course.  How is your book coming along?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh, the muse... we're still having our differences.  You know how it is with women.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Well then, I guess I'd better leave the two of you alone.  But don't forget...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What kind of a horrible thing is that?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: It still worked in town.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I mean the armchair!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh, that was upstairs.  A real antiquity!  I think it's great.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Maybe the antenna's broken.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We're probably lucky that we even have running water and electricity! Damned box!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Hey... the fuse.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh, damnit!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Do you know where fuse box is?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: In the cellar, I think. Wait, I'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Look at this!  We'll have to fix the whole wiring.  This stuff is dangerous as hell.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: We'll call for someone from town first thing in the morning.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Are you crazy?  That costs a fortune!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Do you have a better idea?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I'll do it myself.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: My father was an electrician. Already forgot that?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: My father was a pilot.  And do I know how to fly?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Hey, flower child, the sixties are over.  And this stuff is hazardous to your health.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Yes, daddy.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Well, if you won't let me smoke grass, then at least I'll go get myself some cigarettes.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Making our very own solstice fire.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Is everything alright?  Aren't you feeling well?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I just had a really strange experience.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Maybe I should talk to Dr. Roth about it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Hey, take your time.  You know time heals better than any shrink ever can.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I have a funny feeling.  Do you think we'll get over all that's happened?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We just have to make a new beginning.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Cherry-red Tears.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Cherry-red Tears, your first book. I read it at least nine times.  And then I found out you were going to attend some kind of book fair.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Not a book fair.  I was signing autographs in a department store.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I was so excited about meeting you. Again and again, I kept getting in the back of the line so I could be the last to talk to you.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: And two months later, we got married.  And all because of one sentence:  "With you, my life began and with you shall it end..."

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I miss Tommi so much.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: So do I, believe me.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Do you really think anything can ever be like it was before?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Maybe different.  I don't know, Ellen.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: If we stand a chance at all, it's only by sticking together.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Someone from the village.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Martin, it's not funny!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You know, it's not always easy for me, either.  But at least I try not to give in to each and every neurosis.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Well, apparently it was a big mistake to try talking to you. Don't you remember what we promised to each other?  Honesty - trust!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Come on, this isn't about honesty. You just need a good night's sleep. The way you toss and turn all night, even I hardly get any sleep.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Now, what did I do to deserve this?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Come on, at least try one.  It took me two hours to make these.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: So, did you sleep good?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Yeah... I have to go to town.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Hey, you're still here.  I suppose you like it here with us.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No, thanks.  I have everything I need.  Drive safely, you hear?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Don't tell me you've made friends with that wandering flea circus?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Why not?  She can guard the house. By the way, I gave her a name: Clara.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Where have you been all day?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I went to see Prof. Roth!  You know, I had another one of those dreams last night.  I saw Tommi!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: But that's not the point! What if all these things are somehow connected?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh, baloney.  You should just hear yourself talk!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Where have you been?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: In the village.  Look what I found.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: "Events commonly interpreted as haunting apparitions often result from psychic disharmonies or undigested traumatic ordeals..."

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Ellen, what are you trying to prove, anyway?  That we've created ourselves a ghost?  Come on!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: It's just a feeling.  Don't you sense it, too?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What? What am I supposed to sense?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: The house - Tommi - something just doesn't jive here...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I haven't the slightest idea.
